title: Quibi Is Hollywood's Biggest Short-Form Failure-but Not Its First
summary: Streaming platform pitched high-production shows in format dominated by user-generated content. The demise of the mobile-streaming platform Quibi a mere six months after it went live is the latest example of Hollywood's struggles in making a business out of short-form content.

title: As Biden Eyes Expanded Electoral Map, Memories of 2016 Linger
summary: Polls show Democrat running competitively in purple and red-leaning states, but his party hasn't forgotten its losses in Pennsylvania, Michigan and Wisconsin. WASHINGTON-In the final days before the election, Joe Biden holds significant advantages in polling and fundraising over President Trump along with myriad options for a party desperate not to repeat the mistakes of 2016 but also tantalized by a potential "blue wave."

title: Early Voting in New York Brings Long Lines
summary: Across the city, eager voters wait as long as four hours to cast a ballot on the first day they can vote in person. Hourslong lines snaked around sidewalks in New York City Saturday as many citizens took advantage of their first-ever opportunity to vote for president before Election Day.

title: Lisa Murkowski Will Vote to Confirm Amy Coney Barrett
summary: Republican senator opposed holding vote before the election but says she will back Supreme Court nominee. Alaska Sen. Lisa Murkowski, one of two Republican senators to oppose moving ahead with a Supreme Court nomination before the election, said Saturday she continued to take issue with the process but would vote to confirm Judge Amy Coney Barrett.

title: Where Covid-19 Is Spreading
summary: Resume Subscription. Cases of Covid-19 are rising in broader swaths of the country and some remote areas for the first time, as well as in places that have long had a high prevalence of the illness.

title: Some Companies Make Their Websites More Elderly-Friendly
summary: Faced with users who have deteriorating vision and dexterity, some companies are making their sites easier to navigate and easier to read.. Text that is difficult to see clearly. Small buttons that are hard to select. Key content hidden behind confusing icons.

title: U.S. Has Authority to Ban TikTok, Government Lawyers Say
summary: Proposed restrictions fall within the president's authority to act on national security threats, U.S. says in court filing. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration defended its attempt to ban Americans from using popular Chinese-owned video-sharing app TikTok over national security concerns, saying in court papers that the app makes U.S. user data susceptible to influence by Chinese leaders.

title: How Is the 2020 Election Different From 2016?
summary: An anticipated record turnout and expanded options for voting set 2020 apart from 2016. A: This is an election unlike any other, and a big reason is that an unprecedented number of Americans are expected to vote by mail because of coronavirus concerns. It can take more time to count mail-in ballots than in-person votes.

title: What Are the Deadlines for Counting Mail-In Votes and Absentee Ballots?
summary: Surge in mailed ballots means the vote count may well stretch past Election Day. A: Election officials say the country should be prepared not to know who won the White House on Election Day, citing a surge of mail-in ballots that some states will need extra time to count.

title: During Covid-19, the Girl Scouts' Cookies Didn't Crumble
summary: The new interim CEO talks about arresting the decline in membership, increasing diversity, and cookie sales. Judith Batty made history in August when she was named interim chief executive of Girl Scouts of the USA. She is the organization's first Black CEO.

title: The Push to Vote Early Shows No Sign of Slowing
summary: At least 23 states have already seen more early voting than four years ago, including several battleground states. ATLANTA-Almost half the states in the country have blown past the number of early votes they saw four years ago, with many Americans motivated to cast ballots early because of the pandemic and an eagerness for the election to be over.

title: During Covid-19, Technology Can Help You Find a New Career Path
summary: Strategizing a search and networking have never been easier-even during a lockdown. If Covid has thrown your job, company or career for a loop, this may be the moment to think about not just a next move, but a larger career change.

title: Investors Battle Fidelity in Court Over Tax-Break Deal
summary: Couple says Fidelity's charitable arm botched a stock trade, costing them millions of dollars; investment firm says it did nothing wrong. In the final days of 2017, Malcolm and Emily Fairbairn thought they had everything ready to cushion the income-tax hit from more than $200 million in hedge-fund income. They prepared a large charitable donation, using their relationship with Fidelity Investments and a booming energy stock to maximize their tax deduction.

title: Apps Give Trump, Biden Campaigns Tools to Rally, Track Supporters
summary: Tech allows candidates to control their message, find new voters and offer games with prizes that include a photo with the president. The Trump and Biden campaigns have each developed apps aimed at rallying supporters and swaying votes, but they also collect data on their users and their friends, according to a Wall Street Journal analysis.

title: Look Past Election Blues for Health Stocks
summary: While the sector faces threats from all corners in Washington, the coronavirus has morphed from a risk to a benefit. There is no shortage of uncertainty for health care as the U.S. election draws near, but investors can cross the impact of the coronavirus off their list of worries for now.

title: New U.S. Covid-19 Cases Top 80,000, a Single-Day Record
summary: Cases spreading in remote areas as well as cities that have already battled virus; hospitalizations also rising. The number of new coronavirus cases reported in the U.S. hit a single-day record, as cases spread across communities in every region of the country including remote areas that hadn't yet been hard hit.

title: Illinois Businesses Brace for New Covid-19 Restrictions
summary: New limits on indoor dining leave shops and restaurants in Chicagoland worrying business will tank. NAPERVILLE, Ill.-As pandemic-related restrictions tightened across parts of Illinois this week, small-business owners in this Chicagoland suburb girded themselves for another round of losses.

title: How to Game Plan Your Paused Student Loan Payments
summary: Millions have paused their student loan payments in the pandemic. Here's how to prepare for their resumption.. Millions of student borrowers have been able to pause their loan payments since March, but some may feel unprepared to resume payments when the relief ends.

title: Chile to Hold Referendum on Rewriting Pinochet-Era Constitution
summary: Resume Subscription. Chile's 40-year-old, dictatorship-era constitution has divided citizens into those who credit the charter with laying the foundation for robust economic growth and those who criticize it for undercutting efforts to improve social conditions.

title: Inside Fitbit's Quest to Be Your Health Monitor
summary: Fitbit CEO James Park discusses the company's new products and competition as it prepares to close its acquisition by Google. When Fitbit Inc. launched its first wearable fitness tracker, the market was mostly confined to low-cost pedometers. Thirteen years later, people are hungry for devices that monitor everything from blood oxygen to sleep patterns, which has lured tech giants such as Apple Inc. into the segment.

title: Los Angeles Dodgers Grab 2-1 Lead Over Tampa Bay Rays in World Series
summary: The Dodgers win 6-2 in Game 3 of the World Series. ARLINGTON, Texas-In an era that values power above all, the Los Angeles Dodgers launch plenty of home runs. They hit the most in all of baseball this season, in fact.

title: 'The Salem Witch Trials 1692' Review: Hysteria That Made History
summary: Though it boasts a rich collection of artifacts, the Peabody Essex Museum's exhibition fails to make sense of the colonial-era frenzy.. Salem, Mass.

title: Home Depot Won a Lot of Customers During the Pandemic. The Trick Is Keeping Them.
summary: The retailer gives much credit to its digital technology for attracting DIY consumers. Home Depot Inc. reacted to the rapid spread of Covid-19 in the U.S. by canceling annual sales events and pulling many marked-down goods off the shelves to keep crowds away from stores. But rather than a drop in traffic, amid lockdowns and social distancing, customers began flocking to its physical and online stores, spending stay-at-home savings and government stimulus checks on home-improvement projects.

title: How This Bellman's Marathon Training Got Fine-Tuned During the Pandemic
summary: At the age of 50, Gamini Sugathadasa has found a silver lining to this tough year by focusing on his training and recovery rituals. Most marathoners follow up long training runs with an ice bath and a nap. Gamini Sugathadasa, a bellman at the Four Seasons Hotel Las Vegas, runs 20 miles and then spends eight more hours on his feet. According to his fitness tracker, he averages 14,000 steps during a typical shift.

title: How Europe's Fight Against Covid-19 Went Awry Over the Summer
summary: Race to reopen and return to normal life after lockdowns is haunting countries with a second wave of infections. In the battle against Covid-19, Europe is looking back at a summer of squandered opportunities.

title: Workers Exhaust Time-Off Options as Covid-19, Child-Care Issues Compound
summary: After workers use up paid leave, they are left with few options; some rely on employers' generosity to fill gaps. Millions of workers have taken job leave this year because of Covid-19.

title: New York Police Department Tells Businesses to Prepare for Election Protests
summary: Stores that were damaged by looting earlier this summer have been advised to move street furniture, trash cans and other items on sidewalks before Nov. 3. The New York Police Department has advised businesses located in Midtown Manhattan to take additional security measures in preparation for the possibility of large-scale demonstrations around the coming presidential election, business leaders and police officials said.

title: What Does Outer Space Smell Like?
summary: The molecules that give eggs, vinegar and nail polish remover their distinctive odor are also found in clouds of interstellar dust. Consider making caramel on your stovetop. You start with a single ingredient, white crystals of table sugar, which taste simply sweet and have no aroma. Put the sugar in a pot, apply heat energy and stir. After a few minutes, you've turned the solid crystals into a colorless liquid. Still no aroma. Keep heating, and that liquid turns pale yellow-and begins to smell. It gets light brown, then progressively darker and stronger-smelling. In the end you've made a dark syrup that is sweet but also sour and bitter, and richly aromatic. From one substance you've made many: from simplicity, complexity.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: How to Stylishly Decorate a Room in Your Favorite Color
summary: Leaning on a beloved hue to design a space can look cloying or obsessive. Here's how to do it in a chic and unexpected way.. IT DIDN'T START as a plan at all," said Kate Hume of the predominantly green palette in the living room of her family's vacation home. That said, the Amsterdam-based interior designer admits she might have been unconsciously influenced by the view of trees and open field provided by the windows of the house, located in the Quercy region of France. Next month, the eclectic room will appear in "Élan: The Interior Design of Kate Hume," written with Linda O'Keeffe and photographed by Ms. Hume's husband, Frans van der Heijden (Rizzoli). Its décor came together over years, said Ms. Hume, the green theme gradually emerging-punctuated by touches of yellow and turquoise. Brown, black and white fill in as leavening neutrals, and a blend of textures and styles further layers the room. Key ingredients: matte and gloss pottery both naive and sophisticated; modern rattan; rigid oak; a monumental photograph by Mr. Van der Heijden of leaf insects' mottled wings. "A house can evolve," said Ms. Hume. But if one wants to feature a favorite color, some principles need to be applied.

title: To Find a Coronavirus Vaccine, GlaxoSmithKline Is Bonding With Its Biggest Competitors
summary: The hunt for a solution to Covid-19 is producing an unlikely team of rivals in the cutthroat world of pharmaceuticals. The Covid-19 pandemic is turning some fierce drug-industry foes into the best of frenemies.
